page.title: 04Cattle at Ascott Home Farm.
page.content: At the farm there are 200 pedigree Friesian cows and bulls. 120 cows give milk and the rest are heifers. A cow has its first calf at 2.5 years and then gives milk for about 300 days per year. Each cow produces about 12 litres of milk per day and about 3600 litres per year. The cows are let into the milking parlour 14 at a time. They are sprayed with water and connected to the milking machines (called the clusters). The milk is collected separately for each cow and the amount is written down. When all the milk is removed, the clusters are automatically disconnected and the farmer sprays the udders with a disinfectant. Then each cow moves out and the milk goes to the refrigerated tank where it is stored. It is taken by milk tanker each morning to a Luton dairy for processing and bottling.
